Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • Grid
  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds information about the game grid. Grid holds information about the user's ships. Displayed grid holds information about the shots users makes on the enemy grid. Enemy grid holds information about the AI placed ships and is not accessible by the user. Data about fired shots and successful shots is recorded for both user and AI separately. Grid class holds objects from Ship class: each ship object holds information about a different ship type.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gerda Ugne Pupelyte

      Grid()
      Constructor of the grid class: sets empty values for grids and counters

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        Constructor of the grid class: sets empty values for grids and counters

    • Method Detail

      • setEmptyValues

        public void setEmptyValues()
        A method that sets all values on the board to be empty and prepares it for a new game. The default character for a blank field is ".". Successful and fired shots are set to 0.

      • displayUsersBoard

        public void displayUsersBoard()
        A method that displays the user's board. In order to improve readability, a line of letters is printed at the top of the board and index numbers are printed vertically on the left side.

      • displayEnemyBoard

        public void displayEnemyBoard()
        A method that displays the board of the AI, used for testing purposes. In order to improve readability, a line of letters is printed at the top of the board and index numbers are printed vertically on the left side.

      • fireShot

        public boolean fireShot()
        Method that allows user to fire a shot. User is prompted to choose a field to fire at. If user enters -1, they are returned to the main menu to access options. If a ship is hit, the board is marked with #; If the shot is missed, the board is marked with o. Successful and total shots are counted.
        Returns:
        true or false whether the option menu has to be opened

      • placeAllComputerShips

        public void placeAllComputerShips()
        Method that places all computer ships down on the enemy grid. placeAComputerShip method is called for every different type of ship.

      • placeAComputerShip

        public void placeAComputerShip​(int shipSize,
                               int shipQuantity)
        Method that places all one type of AI ships randomly on the enemy grid.
        Parameters:
        shipSize - - the amount of fields the ship will take up
        shipQuantity - - the amount of ships to be placed of the provided ship size

      • placeAllUserShips

        public void placeAllUserShips()
        Method that places all user's ships down on the grid. placeAShipByUser method is called for every different type of ship.

      • placeAShipByUser

        public void placeAShipByUser​(int shipSize,
                             int shipQuantity)
        Method that places all one type of user ships on the user's grid. The position and place of the ship is chosen by the user.
        Parameters:
        shipSize - - the amount of fields the ship will take up
        shipQuantity - - the amount of ships to be placed of the provided ship size

      • convertLetterIntoNumber

        public int convertLetterIntoNumber​(char letter)
        Method that converts part of the user's input into a coordinate. The method is needed to improve the workflow with the grid array since user sees the horizontal top row as letters.
        Parameters:
        letter - - received letter from the user
        Returns:
        - converted letter is returned as a y coordinate

      • saveGameToFile

        public void saveGameToFile()
        Method that saves current game progress into a file. Saved game data is stored in savedGame.txt file. Current fired and successful shots are saved; Information of all grids is saved.

      • loadGameFromFile

        public void loadGameFromFile()
        Method that loads a previously saved game information into class fields. Information from savedGame.txt file is read. All grids are updated with the information from the file. Successful and total shots are updated as well.

      • getShotsFired

        public int getShotsFired()
        Accessor method for shotsFired field
        Returns:
        shotsFired

      • getSuccessfulShots

        public int getSuccessfulShots()
        Accessor method for successfulShots field
        Returns:
        successfulShots

      • getAIShotsFired

        public int getAIShotsFired()
        Accessor method for AIShotsFired field
        Returns:
        AIShotsFired

      • getAISuccessfulShots

        public int getAISuccessfulShots()
        Accessor method for AISuccesfulShots field
        Returns:
        AISuccessfulShots

      • AIFireShot

        public void AIFireShot()
        Method that allows AI to fire. AI randomly generates coordinates and shoots. If a ship was hit, it's marked with *; if it's a miss, it's marked with o.

      • displayedBoard

        public void displayedBoard()
        Method that displays the board to the player. In order to improve readability, a line of letters is printed at the top of the board and index numbers are printed vertically on the left side.
